title: How to Make Milk Steak With Jelly Beans

steps.title: Add the milk, honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla to a medium sized saucepan.
steps.content: Add the milk, honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla to a medium sized saucepan.

steps.title: Heat up the mixture, stirring until the honey has completely dissolved.
steps.content: Heat up the mixture, stirring until the honey has completely dissolved.

steps.title: Bring the mixture to the boil.
steps.content: Bring the mixture to the boil.

steps.title: Carefully place the steak in the boiling milk mixture.
steps.content: Carefully place the steak in the boiling milk mixture.

steps.title: Bring the liquid back to the boil and reduce the heat so that the milk is simmering.
steps.content: Bring the liquid back to the boil and reduce the heat so that the milk is simmering.

steps.title: Cook this medium-sized steak for five minutes on one side, stirring the top occasionally to stop a skin forming on the milk.
steps.content: Cook this medium-sized steak for five minutes on one side, stirring the top occasionally to stop a skin forming on the milk.

steps.title: Turn the steak over and cook for a further five minutes on the other side.
steps.content: Turn the steak over and cook for a further five minutes on the other side.

steps.title: Check how well cooked your steak is.
steps.content: Check how well cooked your steak is. If you're after authenticity, the steak should be cooked "over hard" and so should not be pink at all.

steps.title: Allow the steak to rest for a few minutes.
steps.content: Allow the steak to rest for a few minutes.
